intro: Datura cornucopia, commonly known as the horned morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces trumpet-shaped blooms that open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in warm, sunny environments. Datura cornucopia is also noted for its toxic properties, containing tropane alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals.
